info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BEAUFORT, CHARLESTON, COLLETON AND BERKELEY COUNTIES... At 644 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Lambert to near Maybank Bridge to near Parris Island, and moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph, up to nickel sized hail and excessive cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. All outdoor activities should cease. Move indoors immediately. Some locations in the path of these storms include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Beaufort, Port Royal, McClellanville, and Edisto Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 15 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
